page.title: 19GARDENING ON ALSTON MOOR
page.content: Gardening is very limited around Alston Moor because of the climate. The town lies 1000 feet above sea level and has a short growing season. The built-up areas are the best places for flowers to grow because of the shelter from the houses. The potatoes and other root crops are protected in the soil. There are two main problems for gardeners, which are high winds and heavy rainfall. These occur most months of the year. The Flower Show is popular with the gardeners and usually has a large number of entries depending on the weather of the months preceding the show. All special prizes are donated for the show (cups, shields etc.).
